cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast, expected to slow, meander inland, then drift back toward the upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near/just north of Corpus Christi

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for upper Texas coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – north of Sargent to High Island TX; Storm Surge Warning – Port Mansfield to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island and into southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible with a 41% cumulative chance; peak gusts could exceed 45–50 mph if outer bands pivot toward Beaumont.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible near Sabine Pass and the lower Neches River tidal areas during onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 inches possible over the upper Texas coast with localized amounts higher, producing life-threatening flash and river flooding in the Beaumont/Port Arthur area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornadic super-cells in outer rainbands; prolonged port disruption due to widespread flooding of access roads and rail corridors.
